title: Create simplified favicon variations from terminal logo design
description: Create multiple simplified favicon variations based on devlog-logo-terminal-v1.svg, removing complex elements like document stacks and replacing terminal/git elements with symbolic representations for better visibility at small sizes

notes.content: Starting optimization of devlog-logo-terminal-v1.svg by replacing MacOS terminal element with CodeOutlined-style icon from Ant Design. This will simplify the design while maintaining the core concept.

Created three optimized logo variations:
1. devlog-logo-terminal-v2-optimized.svg - Replaces MacOS terminal with clean code icon (</>) while keeping document stack
2. devlog-logo-simple-favicon.svg - Simplified version with single document and larger code icon, better for favicon use
3. devlog-logo-circular-code.svg - Modern circular design with prominent code icon and progress dots

All versions use the CodeOutlined style without borders as requested.

Fixed centering and color issues in devlog-logo-terminal-v2-optimized.svg:
- Repositioned code icon to be perfectly centered on top document (translate(32, 38))
- Changed color from overwhelming pure white to subtle light gray (#e2e8f0)
- Improved visual balance and professional appearance
notes.codeChanges: Updated SVG positioning and styling for better visual balance

context.technicalContext: Working with SVG design files in tmp/ directory. The original logo has document stacks, terminal window with header, command prompts, and progress circles with connecting lines. Need to simplify for 16x16, 32x32 favicon sizes while maintaining brand identity.
acceptanceCriteria: Use symbolic elements for terminal/git concepts
